front.title: Service Function Chaining: Subscriber and Performance Policy Identification Variable-Length Network Service Header (NSH) Context Headers

abstract.t: This document defines two Variable-Length Context Headers that can be carried in Network Service Header: Subscriber and Performance Policy Identifiers. These Context Headers are used to inform Service Functions about subscriber- and performance-related information for the sake of policy enforcement and appropriate service function chaining operations. The structure of each Context Header, their use and processing by NSH-aware nodes are described.
